title: Problem 2162_E
statement: We call an array [b_1, b_2, ..., b_m] of length m palindromic if the following condition holds: b_i = b_{m-i+1} for all 1 ≤ i ≤ m In other words, an array is palindromic if it reads the same forward and backward.You are given an array [a_1, a_2, ... , a_n] of n integers where 1 ≤ a_i ≤ n and an integer k.You are required to perform the following operation exactly k times: choose an integer x such that 1 ≤ x ≤ n, append x to the end of the array a. Your goal is to perform these k operations in su
